long: Meaning: (by implication) very widely used as a "relative conjunction" or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed.  Usage: and,   (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly),   but, certainly, doubtless,   else, even,   except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that,   nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore,   (al-) though,   till, truly,   until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet.  Source: a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent;
